Class Scale

extends java.lang.Object
    Image scaling methods.
    Author:
    alanv@google.com (Alan Viverette)

    • Method Detail

      • scaleToSize

        public static Pix scaleToSize(Pix pixs,
                              int width,
                              int height,
                              Scale.ScaleType type)
        Scales the Pix to a specified width and height using a specified scaling type (fill, stretch, etc.). Returns a scaled image or a clone of the Pix if no scaling is required.
        Parameters:
        pixs - Source pix image
        width - The desired width to scale to
        height - The desired height to scale to
        type - The desired scaling type
        Returns:
        a scaled image or a clone of the Pix if no scaling is required

      • scale

        public static Pix scale(Pix pixs,
                        float scale)
        Scales the Pix to specified scale. If no scaling is required, returns a clone of the source Pix.
        Parameters:
        pixs - the source Pix
        scale - dimension scaling factor
        Returns:
        a Pix scaled according to the supplied factors

      • scaleWithoutSharpening

        public static Pix scaleWithoutSharpening(Pix pixs,
                                         float scale)
        Scales the Pix to the specified scale without sharpening.
        Parameters:
        pixs - the source Pix (1, 2, 4, 8, 16 and 32 bpp)
        scale - scaling factor for both X and Y
        Returns:
        a Pix scaled while maintaining its aspect ratio

      • scale

        public static Pix scale(Pix pixs,
                        float scaleX,
                        float scaleY)
        Scales the Pix to specified x and y scale. If no scaling is required, returns a clone of the source Pix.
        Parameters:
        pixs - the source Pix
        scaleX - x-dimension (width) scaling factor
        scaleY - y-dimension (height) scaling factor
        Returns:
        a Pix scaled according to the supplied factors
